base_note.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE - WHOLE LUNG LAVAGE
Date: 2025-04-12
Patient: Frank Johnson | MRN: 3207783 | Age: 52M
Attending: Dr. Maria Rodriguez, MD
Anesthesia: Dr. John Smith, MD
Location: Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, OH

INDICATION: Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis (PAP), anti-GM-CSF autoantibody positive, progressive hypoxia (SpO2 85% on 6L NC). Therapeutic whole lung lavage.

PROCEDURE: Left whole lung lavage under general anesthesia

ANESTHESIA: General, double-lumen ETT (39Fr left-sided)

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Left lung isolation confirmed with fiberoptic bronchoscopy through DLT. Right lung ventilated with 100% O2.

Left lung lavage:
- Warmed sterile saline (37°C) instilled in 1L aliquots
- Total instilled: 15L
- Total returned: 14.2L (95% return)
- Initial return: Milky white (classic PAP appearance)
- Final return: Nearly clear

Procedure duration: 3.5 hours
Lowest SpO2: 92% on FiO2 100%

SPECIMENS: Lavage fluid sent for cytology (lipid-laden macrophages)

COMPLICATIONS: None

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient extubated in OR. SpO2 94% on 4L NC (improved from baseline). Admitted to SICU overnight.

PLAN: CXR in AM. Consider right lung lavage in 1-2 weeks if needed.

Dr. Maria Rodriguez, MD

code_rationales.31624: Whole lung lavage - reported as bronchoscopy with BAL. Therapeutic WLL for PAP.

coding_review.overall_assessment: WLL coded as 31624 - single code covers the procedure.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31624; total_work_rvu=2.63, total_rvu=4.24 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Theresa Lewis
Medical Record Number: 3735971
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-05-22

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with pulmonary alveolar proteinosis - therapeutic wll. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Whole Lung Lavage:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in standardized fashion with sequential aliquot instillation and aspiration to optimize cellular yield. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31624

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-07-21
Patient: Carlos James
MRN: 2632076
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis - therapeutic WLL

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
General

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Whole Lung Lavage performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
Lavage fluid sent for cytology (lipid-laden macrophages)

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31624

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-06-12, Paul Jackson, a None-year-old patient (MRN 4655079), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis - therapeutic WLL. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included whole lung lavage. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is pap. 

Procedural coding: 31624.
